meanings.definition: To transport or be transported instantaneously from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The wizard teleports to the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: She teleports to work every morning to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent3: The cat teleports onto the counter to steal treats.
meanings.sent4: His mind teleports back to the happy days of his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The superhero teleports through dimensions to save the day.

meanings.definition: The act or process of moving or being moved in this way.
meanings.sent1: The teleportation of objects is a fascinating concept.
meanings.sent2: The sudden teleport of the character surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The accidental teleport of the student to the wrong classroom caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: The teleport of information across the internet is incredibly fast.
meanings.sent5: The teleport of the spaceship to a distant galaxy was a remarkable achievement.
